keyword: how many calories in a pint of guinness
title: How Many Calories in a Pint of Guinness?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pint of Guinness, including carbs, protein, sodium, and equivalents, with tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pint of Guinness?
assumptions: Standard Guinness Draught stout, 568 ml UK pint, 4.2% ABV, unpasteurized as typically served on draught.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by type (draught vs. bottled), ABV, serving size, and brand specifics. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A pint of Guinness has about 200 calories, primarily from carbohydrates.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Guinness Foreign Extra Stout (7.5% ABV) instead of Draught
Bottled Guinness Original (4.2% ABV, 440 ml equivalent adjusted)

faqs.q: How many calories in a pint of Guinness?
faqs.a: Approximately 200 calories for a standard 568 ml pint.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a pint of Guinness?
faqs.a: About 18 g of carbohydrates, with no fiber or added sugars.

faqs.q: Does Guinness have protein or fat?
faqs.a: Roughly 2 g protein and 0 g fat per pint.

faqs.q: How much sodium is in a pint of Guinness?
faqs.a: Around 25 mg, which is low compared to many foods.

faqs.q: Is Guinness lower calorie than other beers?
faqs.a: Yes, at 200 kcal per pint, it's often lower than lagers due to its recipe.
